posts.caption:
New form emerged from the kiln today. Tall Layered Vase (~12" tall)
Price: $275

The glaze did something unexpected — Layered blue glaze over speckled clay, with organic dripping effects. Each piece teaches me something new.
posts.engagement: Does this piece speak to you?

posts.caption:
Fresh out of the kiln! 🔥

Abstract Sculpture with Holes
Earthenware with rust and gray glazes
~8" wide
Price: $185

Pretty happy with how this one turned out.

Some days the studio is quiet work, hands in clay, mind elsewhere.

Other days, every mark matters deeply. Today was the latter.

The wheel turns, the water slicks the surface, and suddenly there's something where there was nothing before. That transition — from formless to forming — never gets old.
posts.engagement: What's a piece that's stuck with you?

posts.caption:
Studio day vibes 🎵

Working at the wheel. Clay everywhere. Good day.

Love the energy when everything just clicks.

Some days you make one thing and get lost in it.

Other days you're throwing shapes all afternoon, seven pieces lined up at different stages, and the studio feels alive in a different way.

This is the latter. Green table, chipped paint, clay everywhere. The kind of chaos that means work is happening.

[3] Wide shot (studio context, yellow table in back)

posts.caption:
Studio in full swing today 🔥

Seven pieces on the wheel, clay everywhere, green table's seen better days. Love the energy of a productive session.

posts.caption: Every vase teaches me something. This one taught me patience with Celadon Blue.
